executive_summary.overview: Alba Robot is an innovative Italian startup based in Turin, founded in 2019. It specializes in 'Micro-Mobility' and autonomous vehicle solutions for People with Reduced Mobility (PRM). The company aims to transform indoor pedestrian transport by converting passive wheelchairs into autonomous, self-driving fleets managed via a cloud platform.
executive_summary.brand_details: The brand blends deep tech (AI, robotics, IoT) with high-end Italian design (partnership with Italdesign). It positions itself as a 'Mobility-as-a-Service' provider rather than just a hardware manufacturer, emphasizing inclusivity, independence, and operational efficiency.
executive_summary.market_positioning: Alba Robot positions itself as the 'Waymo of pedestrian areas.' It targets the B2B enterprise market (Airports, Hospitals, Museums) rather than selling directly to consumers, differentiating through its fleet management capabilities and retrofitting technology that bridges the gap between manual aids and full autonomy.

buyer_personas.title: The Airport Special Assistance Manager
buyer_personas.description: Responsible for PRM (Passengers with Reduced Mobility) services. Struggles with staffing shortages and the high labor cost of manually pushing wheelchairs for long distances between gates. Needs a solution to optimize workforce efficiency.

buyer_personas.title: The Hospital Logistics/Facility Director
buyer_personas.description: Oversees patient transport within large medical campuses. Concerned with the efficiency of moving patients between wards and radiology/labs without tying up nurses or porters for simple transport tasks.

buyer_personas.title: The Museum Experience Director
buyer_personas.description: Wants to make the museum accessible to elderly or disabled visitors without them feeling dependent. Looks for a high-tech, aesthetically pleasing solution that enhances the visitor experience.

functional: Transport people with reduced mobility (PRM) autonomously from point A to point B
Return vehicles to charging stations or pick-up points automatically (fleet rebalancing)
Monitor fleet status and location in real-time
Reduce physical contact and effort for staff
emotional: Restore a sense of independence and dignity to the user (self-driving vs. being pushed)
Reduce anxiety about missing flights or appointments due to waiting for staff
Feel innovative and inclusive by adopting cutting-edge assistive tech
social: Project an image of a technologically advanced and accessible facility
Demonstrate commitment to ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) goals regarding inclusivity

problems_addressed.description: Airports and hospitals face chronic shortages of staff to push wheelchairs. Manual transport is labor-intensive (1-to-1 ratio) and inefficient.
Traditional wheelchairs force users to rely on others for movement, which can be dignified and frustrating.
Empty wheelchairs are often scattered or lost. Autonomous return functions ensure vehicles are always where they are needed.
Navigating crowded spaces manually can be dangerous. AI sensors prevent collisions and ensure smooth transport.

unique_selling_points: Proprietary 'SEDIA' vehicle co-designed with Italdesign for superior ergonomics and aesthetics
Universal 'Kit' that can retrofit/robotize existing manual wheelchairs
Voice Assistant integration (Amazon Alexa partnership) for intuitive control
End-to-end Fleet Management Platform for centralized control
value_proposition.differentiation: Unlike competitors like Whill who focus heavily on B2C or simple joystick control, Alba Robot focuses on a B2B 'Fleet' approach with full autonomy and centralized management, specifically designed for large complex facilities.
competitive_advantages: Strong ecosystem partnerships (Italdesign, Teoresi, Amazon Alexa)
Successful pilot programs in major hubs (Torino Airport, Malpensa, Cagliari, Paris CDG)
Focus on 'Made in Italy' design to reduce the medical stigma of wheelchairs

problem_uvp_fit.analysis: The solution directly addresses the critical 'staffing crisis' in global travel and healthcare. By offering a robot that multiplies workforce efficiency (one operator can oversee multiple moving robots), the fit with current market pain points is excellent.

statistics: Test pilots in multiple international airports
testimonials: "We want to become the Waymo of pedestrian areas." - Andrea Bertaia, CEO

products.name: SEDIA (SEat Designed for Intelligent Autonomy)
products.description: A fully integrated autonomous smart wheelchair designed with Italdesign.
products.target_use_case: Premium transport in Airports and Museums.

products.name: Autonomous Kit
products.description: A retrofit kit to transform standard manual wheelchairs into self-driving vehicles.
products.target_use_case: Hospitals with existing fleets of wheelchairs.

products.name: Fleet Management Platform
products.description: Software for the orchestration of the robotic fleet.
products.target_use_case: Control rooms in airports and hospitals.

rental_options.details: Facilities likely pay for the service availability or per-usage rather than buying the hardware outright (though purchase options may exist).

branding.imagery_focus: Sleek, futuristic wheelchairs in clean, bright airport terminals; happy users interacting with voice assistants.
